name: Giardino Grinder
author: Allrecipes
summary: Vegetarian food never tasted so good! Piled high with eggplant, mushrooms, onion, and zucchini, then topped with mozzarella cheese, this Italian-style grinder is a meaty meatless meal.
ingredients: 2  eggplants, peeled and sliced into rings
1/4 cup garlic basil spread (see footnote for recipe link)
1/4 cup garlic roasted tomato spread (see footnote for recipe link)
1/4 cup artichoke aioli (see footnote for recipe link)
directions: Preheat oven to 500 degrees F (260 degrees C)
Heat olive oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat
Cook and stir onion until it begins to soften and turn translucent, about 5 minutes
Add eggplant and cook until they have absorbed some of the oil, about 1 minute
Stir zucchini into eggplant mixture and cook until softened, 1 to 2 minutes
Mix in mushrooms and salt; cook and stir until mushrooms are softened, 3 to 4 minutes
Pour Marsala wine into eggplant mixture and bring to a boil, scraping up any browned bits from the bottom of the pan
Cook until wine has reduced slightly, 2 to 3 minutes
Spread each ciabatta roll with 1 tablespoon garlic basil spread, 1 tablespoon garlic roasted tomato sauce, and 1 tablespoon artichoke aioli
Evenly distribute the eggplant mixture among the 4 sandwiches
Place sandwiches on a baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven until the cheese is melted and the bread is toasted, 3 to 4 minutes
